title: After Taiwan will China invade Japan next? - Quora

response.answer_text: very unlikely. china's dispute with Taiwan has always been internal. No. What does China want from Japan? Nothing. If China’s goal is to dominate East Asia, then it only needs Japan to become a Chinese ally and less of an American ally. BTW, China also wants South Korea to be the same way. That would make Northeast Asia China’s sphere of influence. What is Taiwan’s role in this? If the U.S. does nothing more than imposing a sanction for a few years after China invades Taiwan, then two things will happen. American commitment, whether will or capability, to defend Japan (or South Korea) against enemies will be questioned in Japan and SK. That would make being a Chinese ally politically more appealing.PLA will be positioned to blockade import to Japan, and it can also interdict traffic between Japan and the Philippines, the twin pillar of American military bases in East Asia. This also puts pressure on Japan to be more friendly with China.China may even broker the unification of NK and SK provided the unified country become a Chinese ally. Without the support of Japan and with Taiwan in the hands of PLA, the U.S. would be in a weak position to oppose this development in the Korean peninsula. And all of these starts with the possession of Taiwan by PRC.
